Countermeasures: Fighting the Fade

To combat muscle loss, space agencies currently rely on one main tool: exercise. But is it enough? And what if there's a better way?

The Old Way: Exercise

  • Heavy Lifting: Astronauts must strap themselves into massive resistance machines.
  • Time Consuming: Requires 2+ hours of intense sweating every single day.
  • Incomplete: Even with this effort, some muscle loss still occurs.

The Drawback

It eats up valuable mission time and requires equipment too heavy for a Mars mission.

The Future: NMES

  • Passive Power: Electrical impulses trigger muscle contractions without you moving a muscle.
  • Compact: The device is the size of a smartphone, not a gym.
  • Smart: Can target specific muscle fibers that exercise misses.

The Advantage

Wear it while you work. Maintain muscle mass without sacrificing mission time.
